dialog: Sorry about him. He doesn't understand what it's like, lying there day after day, having people press their ugly faces in on you.  Can you...hear me?  It's just...I've never talked to a snake before. Do you...I mean...do you talk to people often?  You're from Burma, aren't you? Was it nice there, do you miss your family?  I see. That's me as well. I never knew my parents, either.
I swear I don't know!  One minute, the glass was there and then it was gone! It was like magic!
Will I have to wear that, too?
But that's Dudley's old uniform. It'll fit me like bits of old Elephant skin.
Hey, give it back! It's mine!
Because there's no post on Sunday?
They're my letters! Let go of me!
No, you've made a mistake. I can't be...a-a wizard. I mean, I'm just... Harry. Just Harry.
Dear, Mr. Potter. We are pleased to inform you that you have been accepted at Hogwarts' School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
You knew? You knew all along and you never told me?
Blown up? You told me my parents died in a car crash!
First year students will require: three sets of work robes, one wand.
One pair of dragon-hide gloves.  Hagrid, do they mean for a real dragon?
All students must be equipped with...one standard size two pewter cauldron and may bring if they desire either an owl, a cat or a toad. Could we find all this in London?
But why am I famous, Hagrid? All those people back there, how is it they know who I am?
But, Hagrid, how am I to pay for all this? I haven't any money.
Uh, Hagrid, what exactly are these things?
He killed my parents, didn't he? The one who gave me this. You know, Hagrid, I know you do.
Maybe if you wrote it down?
Platform 9¾? But, Hagrid, there must be a mistake. This says Platform 9¾. There's no such thing...is there?
Excuse me, sir. Can you tell me where I might find Platform 9¾?
Excuse me! C-could you tell me how to-
These aren't real chocolate frogs, are they?
I think I can tell who the wrong sort are for myself, thanks.
Say, Percy, who's that teacher talking to Professor Quirrell?
Clearly, Hermione knows. Since it's a pity not to ask her.
What's Seamus trying to do to that glass of water?

Hey, Ron, somebody broke into Gringotts, listen.  Believed to be the work of dark witches or wizards unknown, Gringotts goblins, while acknowledging the breach, insist that nothing was taken. The vault in question, number 713, had in fact been emptied earlier that same day. That's odd. That's the vault Hagrid and I went to.
Give it here, Malfoy, or I'll knock you off your broom!
But I've never even played Quidditch. What if I make a fool of myself?
Does anyone feel like...we shouldn't be here?
Quick! Let’s hide though that door!
I think so. What are those?
What do I do with it?
I think we're going to need another feather over here, Professor.
How could a troll get in?
It’s going into the Girl's Bathroom!
I don't think so. Just knocked out.  Ew. Troll bogies.
Good for you to get us out of trouble like that.
Mind you, she didn't need saving if you hadn't insulted her.
Listen, last night, I'm guessing Snape let the troll in as a diversion so he could try and get past that 3 headed dog. But, he got himself bitten, that's why he's limping.
The day I was at Gringotts, Hagrid took something out of one of the vaults. He said it was Hogwarts' business, very secret.
That's what the dog's guarding. That's what Snape wants.
Who knows? Why was he trying to get past that three-headed dog on Halloween?
But, Hagrid, whatever Fluffy's guarding, Snape's trying to steal it.
Happy Christmas, Ron.  What are you wearing?
Your father left this in my possession before he died. It is time it was returned to you. Use it well.
There was no name. It just said use it well.
Famous fire eaters...15th Century Fiends...Flamel...Nicholas Flamel...where are you?
Ron! You've really got to see this! Ron! You've got to see this!  Ron, Ron, come on. Get out of bed!
There's something you've got to see. Now, come on!
Come on. Come. Come look, it's my parents!
Look in properly. Go on. Stand there. There. You see them, don't you? Thats my dad
How can it? Both my parents are dead.
So, then it shows us what we want? Whatever we want?
I knew the name sounded familiar. I read it on the train that day.
We know about the Philosopher's Stone!
We think Snape's trying to steal it.
Hagrid, we know he's after the Stone. We just don't know why.
Wait a minute.  One of the teachers?
Uh, Hagrid, what exactly is that?
Hagrid always wanted a dragon. He told me so the first time I met him.
I don't understand. Is that bad?
If I didn't know better, Draco, I'd say you were scared.
But what was that thing you saved me from?
But who would choose such a life?
Do you mean to say...that that thing that killed the unicorn...that was drinking its blood...that was Voldemort?

But he's weak. He's living off the unicorns. Don't you see? We had it wrong! Snape doesn't want the Stone for himself; he wants the Stone for Voldemort. With the Elixir of Life, Voldemort will be strong again. He'll... he'll come back.
I think if he'd had the chance, he might've tried to kill me tonight.
I think it's a warning. It means dangers coming. Uhh!  Oh. Of course!

Don't you think it's a bit odd that what Hagrid wants more than anything is a dragon, and a stranger shows up and just happens to have one?  I mean, how many people wander around with dragon eggs in their pockets? Why didn't I see it before? Hagrid, who gave you the dragon egg?  What did he look like?
The stranger, though, you and he must have talked.
And did he seem interested in Fluffy?
We have to see Professor Dumbledore, immediately!
He's gone?! Now? But this is important! It's about...the Philosopher's Stone.
Someone's going to try and steal it.
That was no stranger Hagrid met in the village. It was Snape, which means he knows how to get past Fluffy.
We go down the trapdoor. Tonight.
Snape's already been here. He's put a spell on the harp.
We have to move its paw.
Come on!  Okay. Push!  I'll go first. Don't follow until I give you a sign.  If something bad happens, get yourselves out...Does it seem a bit...quiet?
Lucky Hermione pays attention in Herbology.
I don't know. Sounds like wings.
They're not birds, they're keys. And I'll bet one of them fits that door.
There! I see it!  The one with the broken wing!
RON!  NO! Don't move! Dont forget, we're still playing.  Checkmate.  Take care of Ron. Then, go to the owlery. Send a message to Dumbledore. Ron's right...I have to go on.
You?  No. I-it can’t be. Snape, h-he was the one—-
But-but that day, during the Quidditch match, Snape tried to kill me.
Snape was trying to save me?
Then-then you let the troll in.
I-I’m shaking hands with Dumbledore. I’ve won the House Cup.
Ron was here? Is he all right? What about Hermione?
But, what happened to the Stone?
But Flamel, he'll die, won't he?
How is it I got the Stone, sir? One minute I was staring in the mirror, and the next...
Does that mean, with the Stone gone, I mean, that Voldemort can never come back?
But Hagrid, we're not allowed to do magic away from Hogwarts. You know that.
I'm not going home. Not really.
I can't let you out, Hedwig. I'm not allowed to use magic outside of school. Besides, if Uncle Vernon…
But she's bored! If I could only let outonly let out for an hour or two.
But I haven't had any messages from any of my friends… not one… all summer.
I'll be in my bedroom, making no noise and pretending that I don't exist.
Not to be to be rude or anything, but this isn't a great time for me to have a house elf in my bedroom.
Dobby, ssh! I'm sorry! I didn't mean to offend you, or anything.
You can't have met many decent wizards then.
Stop! Stop, Dobby. Please be quiet! Are you all right?
What terrible things? Who's plotting them?
Ok– I- understand. You can't- say.
Dobby! Dobby, put the lamp down.
Give me the lamp! Dobby stop!
Get in there, and keep quiet!
Yes, sir… See why I've got to go back? I don't belong here. I belong in your world, at Hogwarts. It's the only place I've got friends!
Well, I expect they've… been- hang on- how do you know my friends haven't been writing to me?
I can't. Hogwarts is my home!
Ron! Fred. George. What are you all doing here?
Oh, sorry sir. I'm Harry, sir, Harry Potter.
I'm fine, thank you. I- I was just…
I was lost, I— hang on. What were you doing down there, then?
Well, it's great to see you, too!
I definitely need to remember that one.
Voldemort killed my parents. He was nothing more than a murderer.
Sorry. Lost- lost control of the trolley. Why can't we get through?
The train leaves at exactly eleven o'clock. We've missed it!
Maybe we should just go and wait by the car.
Ron, I should tell you, most Muggles aren't accustomed to seeing a flying car.
Well come on, then. Let's go lower. We need to find the train.
Now all we need to do is catch up with the train.
I'm trying. Your hand's all sweaty.
I think we found the train.
Up! Up! Ron! Mind that tree!
Be thankful it's not your neck.

See you, Hedwig. So, a house elf shows up in my bedroom, we can't get through the barrier to platform nine and three-quarters, we almost get killed by a tree… clearly someone doesn't want me here this year.
Oh- Hi, Colin. Nice to meet you.
No, Colin! Get out of the way! Let's take him to Hagrid's.
Malfoy. He called Hermione, …um, well, I don't- I don't know exactly what it means.
I heard it first in Lockhart's office. And then again just—
It's moving. I think it's going to kill.
Strange. I've never seen spiders act like that.
Oh, no… It's Filch's cat. It's Mrs. Norris.
It's not true sir, I swear. I never touched Mrs. Norris.
When I said I wasn't hungry. We were heading back to the common room when we found Mrs. Norris.
Do you think I should have told them? Dumbledore and the others, I mean?
Well, if there really is a Chamber of Secrets, a-and it really has been opened, then that means---
Well, maybe Ron's right, Hermione. I mean, look at his family. The whole lot of them have been in Slytherin for centuries.
Well, how long will it take to make?
A month? But, Hermione, if Malfoy is the Heir of Slytherin, he could attack half the Muggle-borns in the school by then.
No, I think my- I think my arm's broken.
It was you… You stopped the barrier from letting Ron and me through.
You nearly got Ron and me expelled!
Your Bludger? You made that Bludger chase after me?
You'd better clear off before my bones come back, Dobby, or I might strangle you!
I don't suppose you could tell me why you're trying to kill me?
Why do you wear that thing Dobby?
Repeat itself? You mean this has happened before?
Dobby, stop it! Stop it! Stop, Dobby! Tell me, Dobby. When did this happen before? Who's doing it now?
No, Dobby. Tell me. Who is it?
Sya- hassa- she. Sya- hasi- heth. Sya- hasi- heth.
I know. I mean, I accidentally set a python on my cousin Dudley at the zoo once. Uh, once! But, so what? I bet loads of people here can do it.
What's bad? If I hadn't told that snake not to attack Justin.
You were there! You heard me!
I spoke a different language? But- I didn't realize I- how can I speak a language without knowing I can?
But I'm not… I can't be.
I'll see you back in the common room.
No! Mr. Filch! Y-you- you don't understand!
I… I-I was- I was just wondering if you'd put me in the right house.
Professor! Sir, your bird- there was nothing I could do- he- he just caught fire!
You don't think it was me, Professor?
Ron, maybe I should do it?
We still sound like ourselves. You need to sound more like Crabbe.
I think the Slytherin common room's this way.
But then you must have some idea who's behind it all.
Hermione, come out. We've got loads to tell you!
She should be out of hospital in a few days, when she stops coughing up fur balls… What's this?
Looks like Moaning Myrtle's flooded the bathroom.
Why would I throw something at you?
But, who threw it at you, anyway?
'Do you know anything about the Chamber of Secrets?'
Excuse me. Could you tell me what's going on here? Are you Tom Riddle?
It was Hagrid. Hagrid opened the Chanter of Secrets fifty years ago.
The monster had killed somebody, Ron. What would any of us have done?
W- what's that you've got, Hagrid?
And they found it. Tom Riddle's diary is gone.
We've got to talk to Hagrid, Ron. I can't believe it's him, but if he did set the monster loose last time, he'll know how to get inside the Chamber of Secrets, and that's a start.
I think it's time to get my Dad's old cloak out again.
Look, we have to ask you something. Do you know who's opened the Chamber of Secrets?
Look! Well, come on. Come on, Fang!
You heard what Hagrid said; 'Follow the spiders.'
We're friends of Hagrid's. And you? Y- y-you're Aragog aren't you?
He's in trouble. Up at the school, there have been attacks. They think it's Hagrid. They think he opened the Chamber of Secrets, like before.
Shush. But if you're not the monster, then- then what did kill that girl fifty years ago?
One, but it's not powerful enough for all of them.
Don't mention it. Get us out of here. Now! Come on! Come on! Move faster!
Go on! Go! Get us in the air.
We know one thing. Hagrid never opened the Chamber of Secrets. He was innocent.
Wish you were here Hermione. We need you… now, more than ever.
Ron, this is why Hermione was in the Library the day she was attacked. Come on!

'Of the many fearsome beasts that roam our land, none is more deadly than the basilisk. Capable of living for hundreds of years, instant death awaits any who meet this giant serpent's eye. Spiders flee before it.' Ron, this is it. The monster in the Chamber of Secrets is a basilisk. That's why I can hear it speak. It's a snake!

Because no one did look it in the eye. Not directly, at least. Colin saw it through his camera. Justin…Justin must have seen the basilisk through Nearly Headless Nick. Nick got the full blast of it- but he's a ghost- he couldn't die again. And Hermione…had the mirror. I bet you anything she was using it to look around corners, in case it came along.
The water. There was water on the floor that night. She only saw the basilisk's reflection. 'Spiders flee before it.' It all fits!
Remember what Aragog said, about that girl fifty years ago? She died in a bathroom? What if she never left?
Lockhart may be useless, but he's going to try and get into the Chamber. At least we can tell him what we know.
Professor, we have some information for you! Are you going somewhere?
You're running away? After all that stuff you did in your books?
You're a fraud! You've just been taking credit for what other wizards have done!
To ask you how you died.
This is it. This is it, Ron. I think this is the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets.
Oh, yes there is! You first.
Now remember, any sign of movement, close your eyes straightaway.
You wait here and try and shift some of this rock so we can get back through. I'll go on and find Ginny!
Ginny… Ginny! Oh, Ginny, please don't be dead. Wake up. Wake up! Please, wake up!
Tom. Tom Riddle! What do you mean, 'she won't wake?' She's not…?
She's cold as ice. Ginny, please don't be dead. Wake up! You've got to help me, Tom. There's a basilisk.
Listen, we've got to go! We've got to save her!
But, why did you want to meet me?
Hagrid's my friend! And you framed him, didn't you?
I'll bet Dumbledore saw right through you.
Well, you haven't finished it this time. In a few hours, the Mandrake Draught will be ready, and everyone who was Petrified will be all right again.
Why do you care how I escaped? Voldemort was after your time.
You! You're the Heir of Slytherin. You're Voldemort.
Albus Dumbledore is the greatest sorcerer in the world!
He'll never be gone! Not as long as those who remain are loyal to him! Fawkes?

Don't worry. Ginny, you need to get yourself out. Follow the Chamber, and you'll find Ron. You were brilliant, Fawkes. I just wasn't quick enough… Of course! Phoenix tears have healing powers. Thanks! It's alright, Ginny. It's over. It's just a memory.
It's just… You see, sir I- I couldn't help but notice certain things, certain- certain similarities, between Tom Riddle and me.
Voldemort transferred some of his powers… to me?
So the Sorting Hat was right! I should be in Slytherin.
Dobby! So this is your master! The family you serve is the Malfoys
Sir, I wonder if I could have that?
Mr. Malfoy! Mr. Malfoy! I have something of yours.
Oh, I think you do, sir. I think you slipped the diary into Ginny Weasley's cauldron, that day at Diagon Alley.
Never try to save my life again.
Well, we had loads of help from you. We couldn't have done it without you.
Well, there's no Hogwarts without you, Hagrid.
Lumos Maxima. Lumos Maxima. Lumos Maxima. Lumos Maxima. Lumos Maxima!
Uncle Vernon, I need you to sign this form.
Oh, yeah. Yeah. I've been beaten loads of times.
No! She deserved what she got! Keep away from me.
I don't care. Anywhere's better than here.
I didn't do it on purpose.
The Leaky Cauldron. That's in London.
But the Muggles. Can't they see us?
I broke the law. Underage wizards can't use magic at home.
Sirius Black, you mean? But what's he got to do with me?
Has this anything to do with Sirius Black, sir?
Only that he's escaped from Azkaban.
Mr. Weasley... why would I go looking for someone who wants to kill me?
I didn't mean to blow her up. I just... I lost control.
I think I was lucky not to be arrested actually.
Do you think he's really asleep?
I don't know. Maybe we've broken down.
What was that thing that came?
And did either of you two... you know... pass out?
But someone was screaming. A woman.
She's still doing that after three years. She can't even sing. Exactly. Hey, man. Hey, man. Oh, God. That's awful.
At least Hagrid didn't get fired.
But professor I thought if you signed it, then I could...
Forget about it, guys. See you later.
Professor, can I ask you something?
I did think of Voldemort at first. But then I remembered that night on the train... and the dementor.
Before I fainted... I heard something. A woman... screaming.
I think it was my mother... the night she was murdered.
The most haunted building in Britain. Yeah I know. What's going on?
Excuse me, sir. Where's Professor Lupin?
Probably a right sight better than he normally does.
Really? I meant the match. Who won?
No. Professor, why do the dementors affect me so? I mean, more than everyone else?
I need to know how to fight them. You could teach me. You made that dementor on the train go away.
But you made it go away.
I'm trying to get to Hogsmeade.
Let me go! Come on, guys. Don't...
Mr's. Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs... are proud to present the Marauder's Map.
Hang on. This is Hogwarts. And that... No. Is that really...?
So you mean this map shows...
Brilliant! Where did you get it?
He was their friend... and he betrayed them. He was their friend! I hope he finds me. Because when he does, I'm gonna be ready! When he does, I'm gonna kill him!
The first time I rode a broom.
There's another. It's not... happy, exactly. Well, it is. It's the happiest I've ever felt... but it's complicated.
Just do it. Expecto Patronum! Expecto Patronum!
I think I've had enough for today.
I was thinking of him. And Mom. Seeing their faces. They were talking to me. Just talking. That's the memory I chose. I don't even know if it's real. But it's the best I have.
Ripped to pieces? What are you talking about?
My dad didn't strut. And nor do I. Now, if you don't mind, I would appreciate it if you could lower your wand.
Mr's. Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs... offer their compliments to Professor Snape and...
And request that he keep his abnormally large nose out of other people's business.
Professor, just so you know, I don't think that map always works. Earlier, it showed someone in the castle. Someone I know to be dead.
It's just what I saw. Good night, professor.
Hang on. We better take this back.
Why don't we just set him free?
Hagrid. It'll be fine. It'll be okay.
Ron! Ron! Ron! Ron! Come on! Move!
I have a hunch. I just hope I'm wrong.
I know why. You betrayed my parents. You're the reason they're dead!
No. Pettigrew's dead. You killed him!
All they could find of Pettigrew was his...
Show me. Give it to him, Ron.
I know what he is. But we'll take him to the castle.
Get off! I said we'd take you to the castle. After that, the dementors can have you.
No. Don't worry, okay? It's fine. I'll stay.
Well I just didn't think my dad would have wanted his two best friends... to become killers. Besides, dead, the truth dies with him. Alive, you're free.
What? Come and live with you?
He sent the dementors away. I saw him across the lake.
You mean they're gonna kill him?
I don't know. Going to Hagrid's?
Hermione! Hermione! Hermione, wait. Hermione, will you please tell me what it is we're doing?
You mean we've gone back in time?
Come on. We should be at Hagrid's.
Here they come. I'd better hurry.
He betrayed my parents. You don't expect me to sit here.
Come on. This way. This way, now. Now what?
Before, down by the lake, when I was with Sirius... I did see someone. That someone made the dementors go away.
It was my dad. My dad conjured the Patronus.
You see Sirius talking to me there? He's asking me to come live with him.

When we free him, I'll never have to go back to the Dursleys'. It'll just be me and him. We could live in the country... someplace you can see the sky. I think he'll like that after all those years in Azkaban.
Let's go! What are you doing?
Thanks. Great! Now he's coming for us.
Poor Professor Lupin's having a really tough night. Sirius! Come on!
Don't worry. My dad will come. He'll conjure the Patronus. Any minute now! Right there! You'll see!
Don't worry, he will! He will come! Sirius.

You were right, Hermione. It wasn't my dad I saw earlier. It was me! I saw myself conjuring the Patronus before. I knew I could do it this time because... well, I had already done it. Does that make sense?
I want to go with you.
I don't know. Honestly, Ron. How can somebody be in two places at once?
None of it made any difference. Pettigrew escaped.
For me? But who sent it?
Hermione. Bad dream. When did you get here?
Pleasure to meet you too sir.
Why are they all standing around that manky old boot?
When we're apart my heart beats only for youuu!
Those people tonight, in the masks... they're his too aren't they? they're his followers.
There was a man. Before. There.
I dunno. I didn't see his face.
Oh no thank you I'm not hungry.
Well there's something you don't see every day.
I don't know but I don't think it's Pumpkin Juice.
Yeah well rather you than me.
I didn't ask for this to happen Ron. Okay? You're being stupid.
I didn't put my name in that cup. I don't want eternal glory I just wanna be.. Look, I don't know what happened tonight and I don't know why, it just did ok.
I dunno I haven't really thought about it.
Hey, my eyes aren't glistening with the ghosts of my past.
No. Umm.. Voldemort was giving him a job to do. Something important.
He wanted... me. I dunno why, but he was gonna use this man to get to me. I mean it was only a dream right?
Do you think one of them put my name in the goblet?
I'm not ready for this Sirius.
Who says I was talking to anyone.
Maybe you're imagining things, wouldn't be the first time.
Magical water plants of the highland Lochs?
Yeah I brought the cloak. Hagrid where are we going?
What's with the flower? Hagrid have you combed your hair?
Dragons? That's the first task? You're joking.
No he didn't. He didn't tell me a thing.
Dragons. That's the first task. They've got one for each of us.
You're a right foul git you know that?
I don't give a damn what you or your father thinks Malfoy. He's vile and cruel, and you're just pathetic.
Oh... um... You know I just thought I'd...
Um... I dunno.. I can fly. I mean I'm a fair flyer.
But I'm not allowed a broom.
Who wants me to open it? You want me to open it?
What the bloody hell was that?
Caught on have you. Took you long enough.
Brilliant. That makes me feel loads better.
Hagrid warned me about the dragons.
Who could possibly figure that out? That's completely mental.
Well it does match your eyes. Is there a bonnet?
Oi! Never gonna let him forget this are you?
Why do they always have to travel in packs? How are you supposed to get one alone to ask them...
I think I'd take the dragon right now.
But then again he can take himself.
Um.  I just wondered if maybe you wanted to go to the ball with me?
Um. I was just wondering if maybe you wanted to go to the ball with me.
Ok. Great. Fine. No problem. Good.
Well I expect yours are more traditional.
Because we'd take the mickey out of her if she did.
Really? I had no idea. I suppose Viktor's already figured it out.
Forget about it. I'm sure you would have done the same for me.
I must be out of my mind.
Polyjuice potion! Kicked the habit. Myrtle, did you say try putting it in the water?
Myrtle, there aren't Merpeople in the black lake are there?
Come seek us where our voices sound.
An hour long you'll have to look.
Potentially problematic? When was the last time you held your breath under the water for an hour Hermione?
Neville. No offense, but I really don't care about plants. Now if there's a Tibetan turnip that will allow me to breathe underwater for an hour then great.
You're telling me this now? You must be joking.
Well that makes you sight better than Ron and Hermione. Where are they anyway?
I can come back later Professor.
Sir, Mr Crouch's son, what happened to him?

It's just that I had a dream about him. It was in the summer, before school. In the dream I was in a house and Voldemort was there only he wasn't quite human, and Wormtail was there too and Mr Crouch's son.
Yes. Always the same one. Sir... these dreams, what I see, you don't think it's actually happening do you?
For a moment so did I.
Together, on three. One, two, three!
I've been here before in a dream. Cedric, we have to get back to the cup? Now!
He's back, he's back! Voldemort's back. Cedric, he asked me to bring his body back. I couldn't leave him, not there.
The cup was a portkey. Someone had bewitched it.
I dunno. It was like I'd fallen into one of my dreams. One of my nightmares.
Um. I don't think I said anything about a graveyard Professor.
It was you from the beginning. You put my name in the goblet of fire. You bewitched Krum. But...
Professor, when I was in the graveyard there was a moment... um... when Voldemort's wand and mine sort of connected.
Big D? Cool name, but to me, you'll always be Ikkle Duddicums.
Shut up, Dudley. I'm warning you...
Because if you don't I'll turn you into the idiot pig you are!
Not so brave now, are you Duddykins? Now tell your little friends to go away.
Don't you ever speak about that again. You understand?
Come on! They break into a run. A dementor drifts into the alleyway in front of them. Skidding to a stop, Harry turns around, to find the other dementor cutting off the way back.
They're evil. If they get the chance, they'll suck your soul out through your mouth.
You can't give a Dementor the 'ol one-two.'
Because I used magic to save his
How'd he know? It just happened!
What's been going on? What's Lord Vol-
So, why's he keeping me in the dark?

Dumbledore's brother. It's you I've been seeing -- here. It's
Dung had no right selling you that. It belonged to --

We've been hunting Horcruxes. We think the last one's in the school. But we'll need your help getting in.
If we can find it and kill it, then we kill him, and then we can end this war once and for all. We need to get into Hogwarts tonight.
Dumbledore trusted me, to see this through.
I only care about the Dumbledore I knew. I trusted him.
I had no reason not to —-
Okay. There's something we need to find, something hidden here in the castle. It could help us defeat You-Know-Who.
I realize it's not much to go on.
I think it might have something to do with Ravenclaw. It would be small, easy to conceal, valuable. Any ideas?
Hey there. Ron smiles, about to speak, then notices Ginny's eyes have not left Harry. He frowns, speaks to Hermione.
I think I can help you out with that... -.. Harry appears.
And I'm afraid it's rather extensive.
How dare you stand where he stood.
Tell them how it was that night. Tell then how you looked him in the eye, a man who trusted you... and killed him. Tell them!
Time. As much as you can give me.
Okay. But take this. That way you can find me when you get back.

Ravenclaw Common Room. Got to start somewhere. Hermione nods, slips the Map in her beaded bag and she and Ron head off. Just before they turn the corner, Ron looks back, holds Harry's glance briefly... and then is
I'm a bit preoccupied right now, Luna.
Okay, Luna. Who've you got in mind?
You're the Grey Lady, the ghost of Ravenclaw Tower.
I'm sorry. It's Helena, isn't it? Helena Ravenclaw. Rowena's daughter. Luna told me.
Yes. She thought you might be able to help me.

I don't seek it for myself! You have to believe me!
